intro: Riedelia brunneopilosa, commonly known as the brown-hairy riedelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often forming dense clumps. Riedelia brunneopilosa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
